Articles.Content:
After a very long campaign involving crashing, rockets falling off, realizing I didnt have landing gear, and broken landing gear, I finally achieved a successful Munar landing and a flag plant.

I lifted off the surface in preparation for escape from Munar orbit and return to Kerbin when I realized that I had neglected to place parachutes on my craft.

Upon this rather unfortunate happenstance, I made the decision to remain in orbit of Mun, and await rescue.

Im currently preparing a rescue team to enter Munar orbit and rendezvous with Rayly Kerman, and return him home.

It is imperative that the first kerbal to reach the mun return to his home alive.

However, the nature of Rayly's vessel is such that it cannot dock with other rockets, therefore a successful rescue procedure would have to involve the evacuation of Rayly's vessel and boarding the rescue craft.

It is for this reason that I will need to design a new craft with Rockomax brand parts comprising the final stage, so that the hitchhiker's quarters may be efficiantly incorporated into the design.

updates on mission status will come in shortly

you can mount a lander can under a 1 man pod, it should remain empty when you launch the contraption. If not, have the kerbal in it EVA on the launchpad, and jump to the ground. They seem to be shaken, not stirred, and survive even the blast of the biggest engines in the game when standing right under them
I just leave a Kerbal where I land. So far I have one on Mun, Minmus, Duna and Eve. I doubt the one on Eve will ever be rescued...

When things go wrong, I like to rescue the kerbal/s with an improved version of the craft that got them stuck there.

For Munar rescue missions, external seats are your friend.

Also, welcome to the forums!
